rComments: I think this class is probably the worst class I have taken at UCSC. Professor Sadjadpour is so bad. He is not an engineer, he is a mathematician. To whoever, think's he is the best professor at UCSC, wait until you take a Petersen class. His exams are the same as the year before. He needs to change them so that "lucky" students won't Ace his exam.

He is the litmus test for electrical/computer engineering majors who think they are good at mathematics. This guy is helpful, clear, and his tests are pretty much homework problems (which are difficult). Do the homeworks again and again and you will ace the class.

Best EE professor I've had. Super clear and funny. Ask questions! He will happily answer them (even though he might make some fun of you on the way-but joke back with him and you'll be on his good side). Write down all of the "Golden Rules". Exam problems are straight from HW (mostly). Know all the proofs (even if they don't seem important to you).

Very funny, not afraid to speak his mind to the students. The material in the course can be pretty boring, and he's not kidding when he says the second half of the class is significantly more challenging. Make sure to know your integrals and trig identities. In spite of the class itself, he's a likable guy.

Very intelligent professor and also a pretty funny guy. The material covered was usually pretty dry but he kept his lectures fairly interesting. First midterm was easy but the final was a nightmare.  GOLDEN RULE: Go to class and TAKE NOTES and you should be fine.
Professor Hamid is very intelligent and thorough. I enjoyed his class and he was  very helpful with the course. I would like to take another course with him.
